Class CardHolder

java.lang.Object
CardHolder
Direct Known Subclasses:
Binder, Deck
public abstract class CardHolder extends Object
Abstract class representing a generic holder of cards (e.g., a binder or deck). Stores a name and a collection of Card objects.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public boolean addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to the holder if validation passes.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to be added
      Returns:
      true if card was added successfully

    • removeCard

      public boolean removeCard(Card card)
      Removes a card from the holder.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to be removed
      Returns:
      true if card was removed, false if card wasn't present

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of this card holder.
      Returns:
      the name of the card holder

    • getCards

      public ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Returns a defensive copy of the cards in this holder.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing all cards

    • containsCard

      public boolean containsCard(Card card)
      Checks if the specified card is in this holder.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to check for
      Returns:
      true if the card is in the holder

    • getCardsCount

      public int getCardsCount()
      Returns the number of cards currently in the holder.
      Returns:
      boolean value if cardholder is empty

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns if cardholder is empty
      Returns:
      the card count

    • canAddCard

      public boolean canAddCard(Card card)
      Validates if a card can be added to this holder.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to validate
      Returns:
      true if card is allowed (override in subclasses)
